titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The forenoon was spent in the company of M

Hargreaves, the curate, a young man of ingenous countenance for whom I formed an unusual measure of regard. He shewed me the parish church, a large convenient low–pitched perpendicular building with unusually good acoustics.
After lunch I went to the 'Yorkshire United Independent College', and there delivered an address on 'Christianity & Patriotism'

. The chapel in which I spoke was crowded to excess, & so far as I could see wholly unventilated. The day was sultry & thunderous: accordingly the atmosphere became asphyxiating, & I acquired a bad headache.
